newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nintendo shares hit hard by game software shift.
newsitem.headline: Nintendo shares hit hard by game software shift.

text.p: Shares in Nintendo Co Ltd were heavily sold in Tokyo morning trade on Thursday on news that a videogame software maker would develop and supply the latest version of its best-selling software packages for Sony Corp's 32-bit game player PlayStation.
Nintendo shares slipped 450 yen to 7,550 yen at midday and was the biggest percentage loser on either the first section of the Tokyo Stock Exchange or the Osaka Securities Exchange.
On Tuesday, Enix Corp said it would develop and supply the latest version of one of its best-selling videogame software packages, "Dragon Quest VII", for Sony's 32-bit game player PlayStation.
Media reports on Wednesday -- a national holiday -- said Enix, which in the past supplied Nintendo Co Ltd with Dragon Quest software, would develop the new version exclusively for Sony.
The reports could not immediately be confirmed.
